DOC.brief_summary: Women polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) suffer infertility produce egg month , result irregular period . As result , woman often need medication call clomiphene citrate ( clomiphene ) induce ovulation . A traditional 'clomiphene protocol ' begin short course progestin treatment bring period ( termed 'withdrawal bleed ' ) start clomiphene medication . Newer evidence , however , suggest progestin-induced shed uterine lining ( i.e. , withdrawal bleed ) may decrease chance pregnancy . The purpose study determine whether withdrawal bleed impact pregnancy rate patient PCOS undergo clomiphene cycle . It hypothesize patient undergo ovulation induction clomiphene citrate without prior endometrial shed high clinical pregnancy rate begin progestin-induced withdrawal bleed .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Progestin-Induced Withdrawal Bleed Ovulation Induction Cycles With Clomiphene Citrate
DOC.criteria: Polycystic ovary syndrome ( Rotterdam 2003 Consensus Criteria ) diagnosis anovulatory infertility Age 1838 year At least 1 patent fallopian tube ( demonstrated hysterosalpingogram , hydrotubation hysterosonogram within last year ) Normal semen analysis ( total motile sperm count > 20million/ml ) Normal uterine cavity ( demonstrated hysterosalpingogram , hydrotubation hysterosonogram within last year ) Undergoing ovulationinduction clomiphene citrate without intrauterine insemination ( IUI ) Body mass index ( BMI ) < 17 kg/m2 > 40 kg/m2 Prior treatment clomiphene citrate Presence hydrosalpinx ( see ultrasound , hysterosalpingogram , hydrotubation hysterosonogram ) Those systemic disease diabetes mellitus , uncontrolled thyroid disease , systemic lupus erythematosus antiphospholipid antibody syndrome Any cause infertility anovulation
